title: Duplicate attributes are neither repaired nor reported as an error
description:
From a conformance point of view, duplicate attributes, whether they come from
direct or computed element constructors, or from data model construction in loading
should be forbidden by raising an error (XTST0040, XQDY0026).

Conformance aside, silently permitting instances to have duplicate attributes
is very damaging to downstream processing within XQuery or when XML is
exported to other applications.

support.headline: Duplicate attributes silently accepted and stored
support.supportDescription: Documents containing duplicate attributes in the same element are silently accepted and stored in MarkLogic Server, rather than being somehow repaired or throwing an exception.  This behavior runs counter to the standard.  An element with two instances of an attribute with the same name is not legal XML.
support.workaround: This behavior will not be corrected until 3.1, as it has existed in all previous production releases of MarkLogic Server, and changing this behavior for standards compliance will introduce an incompatibility.

changeHistory.comment: I do not believe that this should be fixed before 3.1, because it will introduce an incompatibility.  Code that previously "worked" will now fail.  Regardless of whether it is compliant to allow duplicate attributes, we've been allowing it since before 2.2.

Fixed in 3.1-20060401
